Sir Walter.text: Heir presumptive , William Walter Elliot , Esq . , great grandson of the second Sir Walter . "
Can we retrench ? Does it occur to you that there is any one article in which we can retrench ? "

the county of Somerset.text: Precisely such had the paragraph originally stood from the printer 's hands ; but Sir Walter had improved it by adding , for the information of himself and his family , these words , after the date of Mary 's birth-- "

and by inserting most accurately the day of the month on which he had lost his wife . Then followed the history and rise of the ancient and respectable family , in the usual terms ; how it had been first settled in Cheshire ; how mentioned in Dugdale , serving the office of high sheriff , representing a borough in three successive parliaments , exertions of loyalty , and dignity of baronet , in the first year of Charles II , with all the Marys and Elizabeths they had married ; forming altogether two handsome duodecimo pages , and concluding with the arms and motto:--"Principal seat , Kellynch Hall , in the county of Somerset , "

Mr Elliot.text: For they must have been seen together , "
once at Tattersall 's , and twice in the lobby of the House of Commons . "
